message.content:
cs.CL, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.NE, cs.CV

This paper is about improving the state-of-the-art Neural Machine Translation (NMT) using attention mechanism. Therefore, the most likely category is cs.CL (Computation and Language), which deals with natural language processing and computational linguistics. The paper also proposes a new approach to address the problem of over-translation and under-translation, which involves maintaining a coverage vector to keep track of the attention history. This suggests that the paper may also belong to categories such as cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) and cs.LG (Machine Learning). Additionally, the proposed approach involves adjusting future attention based on the coverage vector, which may involve neural network architectures and optimization techniques, making categories such as cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing) relevant. Finally, the paper may also involve image processing techniques, as NMT often involves translating text from one language to another, which may involve processing images with text. Therefore, categories such as cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition) may also be relevant.
